remarks: Two perpendicular lines are different.  Theorem 8.14 of [Schwabhauser] p. 59.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 18-Oct-2019.)
statement:
isperp.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
isperp.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
isperp.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
isperp.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
isperp.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
isperp.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. ran L ) $.
isperp.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ran L ) $.
perpcom.1 $e |- ( ph -> A ( perpG ` G ) B ) $.
perpneq $p |- ( ph -> A =/= B ) $.
